list.name: Default
list.comment:
Initial commit. The basic counter works with numbers increasing from 0 to infinity.
(cherry picked from commit e1613f881ca989d55220ad289e091ed7ad4a1e08)

list.name: Initial commit. The basic counter works with numbers increasing from 0 to infinity. (cherry picked from commit e1613f8)
list.comment:
counter is now saved in sqlite database
moved oncreate stuff in fragment to init so that switching counters will be easier

task.summary: mainActivity now disables decrement button when item count is zero. counter class sets default item to "Sheep"
onLongClick on the value or the item name opens a dialog box to enter the value, some files renamed, some strings added
trying to fix my damn git :P
dialogbasic.xml added since last push didn't allow for some goddamned reason
textdialog.xml added since last push didn't allow for some goddamned reason
confirmation toasts for successful item and value edits, comments added

converted everything in mainactivity into a fragment, created a fragmentpager for future use in a settings and a timer page, renamed the main layout to counterfragment, added a dummy fragment page layout
So far, everything is miraculously working somehow. Boy, converting into fragments is tough love. Learned a LOT.
added a simple line in mainActivity to set default fragment on creation. switch statement in getItem inside pager uncommented to work properly

added settings functionality. reads the settings and performs actions. now i need to add a onsharedpreferenceschangedlistener and make this proper.
also added a countersettings class to make storing the settings of individual counters simpler.
whew this is tough but cool

moved sharedpreferences to settingsClass object first to avoid repeat sys calls
had created a onsharedprefs listener in the counterfragment but it can't communicate effectively with the prefs fragment so i'll have to move it to the prefs fragment and communicate through the activity or move the prefs fragment to it's own activity. i dunno. have to redesign the whole thing in photoshop :(
my baby, i hope u turn out alright in the end

added a callback onSettingsChanged to send data to activity from settingsFragment. added function counterSettingsChanged to counterFragment to receive changed settings from activity. removed members from counterSettingsClass that will be redundant in future. better to let them stay on SharedPreference.

counter is now saved in sqlite database
moved oncreate stuff in fragment to init so that switching counters will be easier

MESSAGE.value: mainActivity now disables decrement button when item count is zero. counter class sets default item to "Sheep"
Now, onLongClick on the value or the item name opens a dialog box to enter the value.

So far, everything is miraculously working somehow. Boy, converting into fragments is tough love. Learned a LOT.

added settings functionality. reads the settings and performs actions. now i need to add a onsharedpreferenceschangedlistener and make this proper.
also added a countersettings class to make storing the settings of individual counters simpler.
whew this is tough but cool

moved sharedpreferences to settingsClass object first to avoid repeat sys calls
had created a onsharedprefs listener in the counterfragment but it can't communicate effectively with the prefs fragment so i'll have to move it to the prefs fragment and communicate through the activity or move the prefs fragment to it's own activity. i dunno. have to redesign the whole thing in photoshop :(
my baby, i hope u turn out alright in the end

added a callback onSettingsChanged to send data to activity from settingsFragment. added function counterSettingsChanged to counterFragment to receive changed settings from activity. removed members from counterSettingsClass that will be redundant in future. better to let them stay on SharedPreference.

counter is now saved in sqlite database
moved oncreate stuff in fragment to init so that switching counters will be easier
